item.title: There is vegitation hanging out dangerous, 18th July
item.description:
There is vegetation hanging g out u can't see traffic coming over the a40 bridge on Pirton lane when pulling out of yew tree way this will cause an accident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Droy's Court intentionally making footpath difficult to use, 18th July
item.description:
Throughout the year the paths are intentionally left flooded/deep mud to dissuade users. Cows are intimidating and on all footpaths through farm. Currently there are trees piled up against the footpath gate. Unpleasant atmosphere to put off public footpath users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scrap metal dumped in Pittville Park, nr sports centre, 18th July
item.description:
This area of Pittville Park is being used increasingly for fly-tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tommy Taylors Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 18th July
item.description:
Visibly blocked gully and will not take any water away if this heavy rain happens. The drains in this area seem to be neglected and lots of them are full.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole with large chunks of tarmac missing., 17th July
item.description:
What 3 words location -Impulsive,heat,little Awful break up of road, large chunks of tarmac missing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Double yellow lines not visible, 17th July
item.description:
The double yellow lines between 54 Leckhampton Road and 62 Leckhampton Road are very faded/not visible in places. When Leckhampton Road was resurfaced they only repainted yellow lines on the new surface. The new bright lines that end abruptly make the old faded lines almost invisible. This is dangerous by the traffic island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
